original:
Lung volume in mammals is closely correlated with body mass, exhibiting a slope of 1.02. Specifically, the lung volume averages 63 milliliters for each kilogram of body mass, with the tidal volume at rest being approximately one-tenth of the total lung volume. 

Respiratory costs, in relation to oxygen consumption, scale according to the formula \( M^{0.75} \). This indicates that mammals, regardless of their size, possess similarly sca
